content.description:
A hard to spot line,

Surfing the Orgasmic Wave

climbs a dark water streak past a few bolts over thin and dicey terrain.

Starting low in a crop of boulders, climb up to a small ledge and gain an awkward broken flake.  Follow this feature to a difficult to hold stance. Break hard right over a blank and cryptic face to join the remaining and more climbable slab.

Climb straight up over thin edges and shallow pockets to a chain anchor. Consistent, Continuous, and Unforgiving! Classic City of Rocks.
content.protection: Five or six bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location:
On the north side of the

Heartbreaker

buttress,

Surfing the Orgasmic Wave

climbs the right most line of green painted bolts. The start is easily found by locating a small tree on the middle most ledge.

content.description:
Heartbreaker

is a classic line, which does not see a lot of traffic due to its location.  The next time you are at

Boxtop

or

The Odyssey

, you should stop and check out this beauty.  It is one of the better 5.10 trad lines at the City.

Follow the thin leaning hand crack to the crux move entering the dihedral.  The crack above eases to easy 5.10 with good jams and gear.  Save at least one #2 camalot for the anchor, which is hand size gear.
content.protection:
2 sets of cams from .5 - 2 camalot, 2-3 lg nuts

bring an extra .75 and 1, if you want to sew it up
content.location: This route is located on the north side of the rock and starts on a exposed ledge that is gained by a low fifth class scramble.
